website_summaries.verdict: The Beyerdynamic DT 770 Studio headphones are a classic that are still relevant thanks to excellent audio performance, a stable fit, and a reasonable price for what you get.
pros: Excellent audio performance, with superb high frequency clarity and accuracy
cons: Not for use with mobile devices
Not for those seeking highly boosted bass

customer_reviews.title: Jack and Adaptor Snapped
customer_reviews.text: I had an initially good impression of these headphones, however, the jack adaptor snapped at the base, and with it went the tip of the 3.5 jack so these are now useless. The break reveals the jacks are just plastic tubes wrapped in yellow metal. Extremely disappointing. UPDATE: Whilst it wasn't easy to find the information I needed, I was able to get in touch with Beyerdynamic and they arranged to repair them without any fuss. All I had to do was pack them up and mail them across. The repair was fast and hassle-free and I had them back within 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: M/R

customer_reviews.title: Best wired headphones I have owned so far
customer_reviews.text: Best wired headphones I have owned so far. Love the clarity and response. they can handle themselves amped up too. very comfortable over long periods. I use them predominantly with my PS4 either gaming - including VR and they just clear the headband - perhaps a little too close though I am worried that repeated use with vr might result in damage to my phones (i'll just buy another pair), or watching movies with my amp plugged in for extra crunch. I love these. they are quite large and the wire is quite long too.
customer_reviews.author: RANDAMNATION

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing cans. Cheap components and utilitarian looks (which some like.) Good comfort, and initially impressive sound, but the boost in the upper mids quickly becomes grating, and the sucked out lower mids (typical ploy to give the impression of a wide soundstage) doesn't impress an experienced listener. The age old problem of the white paint on the model id on the sides of the cups doesn't impress either. Ok. in hifi terms they are cheap and cheerful, but The almost hysterical praise bestowed upon them on line and in reviews is unwarranted. (From a headphone listener of 45 years of cans right across the spectrum.)
customer_reviews.author: NAS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound and build quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the production of home recordings. On first use, I could hear so much more detail than the computer speakers or my Bose QC15. When I tried a professional recording the result was excellent. I didn't buy these for the gaming but as this review prompted me to give a score I tried them and wow! I heard sounds in the games that I had never heard before. For those with questions about the impedance. I have a Rubix 22 interface and these headphones are the 80Ω model.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones that I've had the pleasure of using
customer_reviews.text: The best headphones that I've had the pleasure of using. They are so comfortable, the velour ear pads are very pleasant. The build quality is solid, the sound is amazing with a really punchy, strong bass and music, games and films sound amazing while using them. The packaging is first class, German engineering at it's best. A must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Benji

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are excellent! The quality truly is amazing in terms of sound with a clear and balanced response. I personally love the openness of the low end of these headphones allowing for high bass level without it being oppressive in the mix. The highs are very clear and crisp and the kids are very beautiful with a even singing tone. The durability is also excellent and I love that any of the parts can be ordered individually. I haven’t had to order any new parts in several but it’s comforting to know that this is an option. Excellent for their price - would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: George Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Promising
customer_reviews.text: This is just initial feedback as they only arrived today I've yet to run these in. However I'm already hearing things I hadn't noticed on some of my CDs before. The bass appears firm and clear. Top end seems more sibilant than I'm used to, but I'll wait to see if running them in changes that. My main reason for buying these over the DT880's or 990's (sound isolation when using these to monitor recording at home) seems to be delivered reasonably well
customer_reviews.author: Colin_M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and comfort. Just wish they came with a detachable cable
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound quality of these and the build but I am just disappointing that the cable is fixed so whenever it finally gives out the whole £100+ headphone will need to be replaced! As I need to tidy up the cable after every use (cats in the house would otherwise destroy them) I worry about how long the cable, and therefore whole thing, will last, so I am worried about such an expensive headphone dying on me soon. All being said though, the sound is incredible for mixing and recording music as well as practising my digital piano. the sound is so good its almost better than hearing it through the speakers!!!
customer_reviews.author: yasaman mirabolfathi

customer_reviews.title: Give them 10 days....
customer_reviews.text: I liked them then I hated them then I loved them. They're different from what you're used to. I have a pair of Bowers & Wilkins P5's - on ear which are brilliant but uncomfortable after a while. These are really comfy for long listening sessions but are quiet with a pixel 2xl android phone. I bought a little Bluetooth dac/amp and they came alive! The volume was an issue for me, I bought the 32 ohm version which is supposedly suited to mobile devices but they haven't got the oomph which is why I bought a heading headphone amp. They're great headphones but you really need an amp to bring them alive so factor in another 50 quid.
customer_reviews.author: Lebowski

customer_reviews.title: 250 ohm not suitable for Focusrite interface
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 250 ohm version as I am using it with a Focusrite interface for recording and mixing guitar, vocals etc. I thought the 250 ohm version would be the best match from descriptions and reviews however the volume was massively lower than the Phillips (less expensive) headphones I was currently using. So much lower I have returned them and ordered the 80 ohm version. It was a surprise to me so if you are using a Focusrite Scarlett interface then I'd suggest not getting the 250 ohm version. The headphones looked great quality and have a good reputation so I will do another review once I have the 80 ohm version in a few days
customer_reviews.author: Penicuik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first set of Audiophile headphones
customer_reviews.text: My first set of decent headphones. I can power them at 80% volume from my Samsung Galaxy Edge S7 phone but I'll be looking to purchase a Fiio E10K amp in the near future. Amazingly comfortable thanks to the velour ear pads, I can wear them for hours at work and at home. They were recommended by my friend, a DJ for Chorley FM and comparing them to the 250 ohm studio version he uses, there is very little difference other than volume when connected to a non-amplified source and a slightly bassier tone on my 80 ohms. It's no wonder these headphones have been popular for years and remain a favourite still
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: 250ohm Beyerdynamics DT770. The ones for studio monitoring and mastering...
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with the 250 ohms. After a lot of reading up on the different variants, I opted for these for quality, not loudness (see the lower ohm DT770 headphones for this). I purchased for added studio monitoring. They are really articulate and do pick faults with a bad mix down, so perfect for my intended use as a reference. As a side note, these headphones are loud within a studio environment, just plugged straight into a mixer. I have never needed to turn them over 50% on volume without hurting those delicate ears... Another added bonus, as with all the DT770 range is that you can get spares, which is brilliant for wear and tear, cups, headband, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Matt

customer_reviews.title: The classic.
customer_reviews.text: Epic. Had these in the 32ohm version for nearly 10 years and decided to pick up the these to use without an amp. Still as epic as ever, with some stunning bass and clarity when it's supposed to be there (I'm a dnb & glitch-hop / electro would guy) - yet they don't overly warm things and muddy them with emphasis on the bottom end when it's NOT supposed to be there. Super comfy with the velour pads and just an epic REAL studio quality set of cans for a brilliant price.
customer_reviews.author: markh

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: I've been listening and playing music all my adult life and know quality sound when I hear it. These headphones are real value for money. The sound spectrum is wide with excellent high and low frequency response. The phones are really comfortable to wear for lengthy periods of time. The sound insulation is extremely good too, keeping both the sound you're listening to and external sound apart. I'm really thrilled with them and can wholeheartedly offer my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect headphone for mobile devices
customer_reviews.text: Very nice headphone, good mid range and bass, I totally love the Beyer sound signature, currently own a number of their headphone including the DT770-80 pro, DT770-250 pro, DT880, DT990-250 pro plus a number of modified DT770-80 pro, so you can say I like them a lot. I personally didn't like the leather pad so I swapped it for the 'Norman's beyer pad. I bought this 32 ohm version as it is easier to drive with my mobile devices, 80 and 250 is just too hard for phones and tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Spanky

customer_reviews.title: Great for home studio/long music listening session
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great, particularly the vocal and music instruments separation. Hear more details comparing to the noise cancellation headphones I have. I purchased 250 ohms as mainly to use with my Dell XPS 13 at home, reaching hi-fi sound stage while using with iFi Zen AMP/ DAC. I also love the retro design of the headphone: the head-bang & closed back ear-pads are so comfy for long session!!! Will definitely recommend this pair of headset as the sound quality and comfort-ability are awesome at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Best headhphones I've used
customer_reviews.text: Get the one with Velour pads. The comform is amazing and the sound quality is just stunning for the price. If you can buy a DAC (Digital to Audio Converter, e.g FIIO E10K) and you are set. They are superb comfortable and my ears don't get sweaty at all. Sound clarity is amazing. If you use spotify make sure that the streaming and download is set to max quality. Check out some 24bit music on YT or download some. Make sure your OS and spotify/YT sound is set to 100% if you use a DAC.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: To really appreciate these, you need 192khz 24 bit music files, and a DAC equipped phone, or proper such as the LG V40 which I'm using, and then the clarity becomes amazing, especially on the said rate on streaming services like Qobuz and Tidal. I've tested the frequency response range, and bass as low as 5hz and treble above 16khz is perfectly audible. Just remember that these are 250 ohm headphones, so your audio equipment needs to be able to push them.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo77

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cans.
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a decent headphone amp these are fantastic. The big cans completely surround the ears and with the closed back and tight but comfy headband they keep the noise in/out well. I've nothing of similar quality to compare against but the sound is amazing to my ears. So much detail and clarity from top to bottom, nothing sounds overcooked. I actually prefer listening to these than thro speakers. I wear spectacles but these are still comfortable enough for several hours of continuous wear. On a practical note, the coiled cable is good and tidy - no trip hazard! Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were right: this is an outstanding set of headphones. Very comfortable, excellent sound stage, wonder bass and sound generally. However, it does need an amplifier amp to be driven (otherwise, be prepared to be underwhelmed!). I used the excellent SMSL SAP-1 Portable Desktop Headphones Amplifier when connecting the lot to my stage piano, and the result is just superb!
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: What a sound!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a sound!!! I bought these to replace a set of ATH-M50X which was hurting my ears when listening to some high frequencies,and ATH did not sound as clear as I wanted to. Beyerdynamic DT770Pro are really AWESOME!! Very comfortable! Not as boomy as ATHM50X but mych more clearer and with great separation and the sound stage is much more open,and not "in your face" as with ATH-M50X. Connecting them to my home amplifier made me fall in love with them!!
customer_reviews.author: Kifeto

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones but flawed bass
customer_reviews.text: They are an absolute pleasure to wear and are really comfy compared to the hd25s which were my dailies producing drum and bass. They sound a bit better than the 25s but to me the low end lets it down which sounds distorted and breaks up quicker in comparison and throughout the frequencies at volume. I'm going to return and get the dt990 pros instead as my producer friend recommended me them with a better bass, treble and general response overall.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Cowie

customer_reviews.title: Powerful amazing sound!!!
customer_reviews.text: I so much enjoy those headphones! I take it to the gym (perfectly stays on!), I listed to music on my mobile and laptop. It blocks outside sound very well (be careful on the streets but you will appreciate that on the plane, believe me...:) The sound is absolutely amazingly deep and spacious! Almost touchable! I can hear much more details of songs that I use to listen on my old headphones. I was worried that it will be too big for my small head but it is perfect. When buying pay attention to which Ohm you need - it matters! Will be choosing this brand for other sound related equipment for sure! I totally recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They provide a true reference. What you hear is what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this model for writing and referencing for 10 years. Bass response is full and vibes, but not flabby. Nobody likes a flabby bottom right ? Mids and High frequencies are quite neutral. Imaging and soundstage are true. Basically, what you hear is what you get. I mainly work between these and the Adams A7x monitors and nothing ever jumps out as being wrong when referencing between the two. They are also extremely comfortable, you can work for hours with no listening fatigue or discomfort. Downside is you need really to change them every couple of years and the moulded jacks and leads are not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 250ohm version as I use them primarily as a mix engineer. I used the same AKG headphones for 10 years and finally decided enough was enough. Went for these and the dynamic range is great. They allow me to hear a clearer picture when I'm in a room I'm not used to. A good sense check. I also tried them out gaming on a PS4. Being 250ohm I obviously had to turn the audio up but they're great for gaming too
customer_reviews.author: Bouf

customer_reviews.title: great  headphones  at a good  price
customer_reviews.text: never owned dedicated studio quality headphones before , i knew my soundcard in my pc could do 600 ohm so decided to try these 250 ohm ,sound quality is fantastic instruments in a song you can pick out and some sounds in a song i had not listened to before , build quality is fantastic ear cushions are allso very comfortable you can wear these for long periods of time without discomfort or sweating i find , i allso use these for pc gaming which gives a great experiance
customer_reviews.author: susan goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: These phones are made so well, very solid , thick strong lead , they look like they will last forever. The sound quality , which is the most important thing , is very good . I don`t like excessive bass and you don`t get it , what you get is real quality of note and every background tone that is missing on normal play without headphones .I`ve paid more for others and these are as good if not better . They are not super lightweight if that`s what you are after . I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: The 'phones you need.
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a desk all day and the last pair of headphones I owned were rubbish. I bought the DT770s after watching Richard Ashcroft wearing a pair on the Chris Evans Virgin breakfast show clip. The 80 ohm version is more than loud enough on my desktop PC (and comes with the velour ear pads and the 3m lead which the 32 ohm doesn't). I have now worn these 'phones for two days solid and would like to report that they sound great, are lightweight (no Wharfdale DD1s here) are superbly comfortable (even with clunky glasses) and the 3m long lead means I can move my head without fear of breaking the plug off. Overall, fab.
customer_reviews.author: CA Jones

customer_reviews.title: Noise Isolation works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can practice piano while people are watching TV. When you pop them on first you may be disappointed that you can still hear other sounds, but the moment you start listening through them you can't hear a thing from outside. Quality is fine I have tested with only TV/talking, cooking noises, kids annoying me etc. No idea if it stops aircraft noise etc. Would be very suitable for noisy office. I have a fat head and its still comfy, but its a very firm fit so if you're looking for all day office headphones I would probably consider something else. I got the 80 Ohms version and my digital piano drives it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Mixing
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for mixing. - 80 ohms version 1. Build quality very good - cable quite long and very comfortable to wear for long periods 2. External noise - very little noise (if any) gets through - when taken off my computer fans sounded like a jet plane taking off. 3. Clarity - very clear with Hihhats very clear 4. EQ - overall seems like a very flat EQ (no booming bass or brittle Highs screeching at you - unless they actually are) 5. Value for Money 10/10 Used with Steinberg UR22MkII USB powered interface as loud as normal headphones - so no power problems
customer_reviews.author: noname

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to rave about
customer_reviews.text: not a bad headphone but doesnt live up to its hype IMHO. Besides being quite hard to drive the sound matches their plastic construction and can sound well a bit plastic'y. If you want a better all rounder with more of a natural sound go with the audio technica ath-m40x
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Amazing multi use headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing set of headphones. Excellent sound. Used heavily for music use during travels and also a lot of gaming. Holds up incredibly well for both. Positional sound is spot on with these headphones. Pretty comfy but I did opt for a separate pair of memory foam ear cushions instead of the standard plush ones. Build quality is really good. Bought m50x's at the same time to decide which one to keep and sound wise they are very similar but comfort and build quality hands down goes to the DT 770 pro's. One of the best things I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Don Simon

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones, nice price point
customer_reviews.text: These are nice headphones, I bought them primarily for doing some recording and mixing and wanted a nice clean and mostly flat response headphone, got what I wanted, after listening to some recordings I know very well I could even hear a bit more detail. Good budget headphones overall. They are also more comfortable than my old pair of Sennheisers which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all around home use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because the reviews looked solid and needed some headphones that are dedicated for home use. The sound quality is instantly noticeable. They do not have unbalanced sound in the lows or highs, the balance is perfect. Studio monitors mean they have a long wire, useful for dedicated home use when traversing your room. Does not require a DAC with modern devices but still worth getting one if you want the extra enhanced experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: My new favourite headphone!
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a pair of Beyerdynamic DT880's before purchasing the 770's. The 880's, although very clear and spacious, I always felt they were a bit light on bass for the type of music I tend to listen to (electronic mainly). The 770's (I have the 80 Ohm version with a Beresford Caiman DAC/headphone amp and Sonos Connect) fill in the gap with much more bottom end, without sacrificing the clarity of the mids and highs. Sound isolation is excellent to so you don't need to play them too loud to get the full effect. Well worth buying especially given the relatively low price.
customer_reviews.author: SilverGrey

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy as fud.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Very comfortable. Right channel died suddenly after light use at home only. Pathetic manufacturing standard. Maybe I was unlucky, but this seems to be a too common problem. Doubt I will ever buy full size headphones with a fixed cable again.
customer_reviews.author: R. husbands

customer_reviews.title: I'm a little disappointed according sound quality of DT770 80Ohm comparing to Hifiman ...
customer_reviews.text: After 3 days listening with ifi idsd nano bl: I'm a little disappointed according sound quality of DT770 80Ohm comparing to Hifiman HE-400i. The sound of 770s is not as rich and transparent. Bass is kinda dry. Trebles are harsh and sibilant - could be annoying. All in all - dry sound. But they have some increased response on about 50-60Hz, so could punchy on some artificial heavy bass music. Sound stage is quite wide for closed headphones. Velour earpads are comfortable but leaks a lot of sound - not good choice for work in office. I hope that more warming up could help with the sound, and I want to try with another amp|dac.
customer_reviews.author: Serge

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate. These are perfect
customer_reviews.text: After swithering over these or the m50x I went for these. I have recently purchased an LGG6 with the Quad dac and needed some proper headphones. My Senheissers just were not cutting the mustard. I went for the 80ohm as I knew the phone would be more than capable of driving them. And these are fantastic headphones. Im hearing a whole new side to my favourite music and I couldn't be happier. These are also the most comfy headphones I have had. There are literally no drawbacks to these imo.
customer_reviews.author: MickH

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these headphones`
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace 3 year old beats pro studio headphones, and the quality difference is unbelievable. Very impressed with these, with sound quality, but especially comfort on ears. The earpads are extremely comfortable, and fit around the whole of my ears allowing for comfortability, and has taken away the headaches I used to get from my old headphones and earphones. I definitely like the fact that all parts are replaceable, and how durable they feel. A few people discussed the need for an amp for these, I would suggest getting them and trying it, as I definitely don't need one with these. Would definitely recommend as studio headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Hugely disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought for listening to lossless music via my PC with Brunson V6 Vivids- I'm shocked at how poor the sound quality is (across every genre), & how uncomfortable they are- *really, horribly* tight, & heavy (my head circumference is 60cm, as a reference) Managed about 3 hours with them, before starting a return. It's cool that you get a soft carry-case with them, tho.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best For mixing / home listening
customer_reviews.text: The detail in these is incredible. it was a choice between these and the audio technica M50x and i reasoned that the balance across the mids would work better for me than a scooped mid with more punchy bass and top. I was correct, i even worked out that my near field studio monitors had not been telling me the truth and so i will be replacing those soon as well. you wont find a better sound for listening at home or working on audio at his price point!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are brilliant. I wanted headphones that I could use with various devices - TV, computer etc and listening to my old prog rock cds on good hi-fi. The sound quality on all devices is excellent and they are well-built and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Fair Comment

customer_reviews.title: Always were, and still the best value headphones on the market today.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I bought my first set of Beyerdynamic headphones back in the 1970’s when I still had reasonable hearing. Going through a renaissance in my 60’s trying to recapture the sounds I heard then. Obviously difficult when I have profound hearing loss! However, driven by a Music Fidelity LX2-HPA headphone amp I’m hearing detail and quality I haven’t heard in decades- wonderful to rediscover music again. Always were, and still are the best value quality headphone on the market.
customer_reviews.author: ShetlandRocks

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these headphones everyday for a year and I am very pleased with them. My only gripe is the fact that I did not purchase a high ohm pair but that's my own fault. The sound quality is excellent and the build quality is very good. I would definitely recommend these headphones and I hope my current pair continue to work for a while yet. Beyerdynamic offer replacement parts for every section of the headphones which I have not seen from many companies. Overall very good!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: It did not work
customer_reviews.text: The headphones have a manufacturing problem, you can search online ... it makes it sound "canned" ... I have had bad luck and I had to return them
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly disappointed with these to be honest. I bought the 32ohm version, but I'm surprised how quiet they are when plugged into my phone and the sound quality is about average to me. Don't get me wrong, they're not bad per se, but they're certainly not worth over £100 either in my opinion. I'd be willing to try other alternatives in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for these already own a pair of audio technica studio monitors which are amazing, full sound highs and lows.. The excitement of unpacking these was soon dampened by the sound quality, lacking in bass and sounded like a very cheap pair. Build quality and design very nice and well made but the essential part the sound just a disappointment.. Returned for a refund
customer_reviews.author: R. facer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing item, totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price, as I am sick of buying cheap earphones every 3 months I think this is totally worth it. Noise cancellation is very good and sound is superb too. When I used it the first time it was like listening to a different song because sound and vocal were so crystal clear and base was amazing too. I'd recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cumin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for laptop music production.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO headphones to use for portable music production on a Macbook pro when I'm not in the studio. A few weeks in I have found them to be extremely comfortable for long hours and they have a very good level of detail in the sound for my needs. The only slight negative for me is that i find them to be a little quieter than I would have liked so have to use gain boost on Logic Pro X.
customer_reviews.author: AMIRJIT HAYER

customer_reviews.title: Wow. My search for something special is over!
customer_reviews.text: I have MDR 7605 and they are fantastic for producing and PC gaming (Counter Strike of course). Had to buy another pair of headphones for college, where I produce music and game (CS on the go). These cans are fantastic, very comfy, sturdy and look superb. I've seeen people talking about harsh highs, but I dont agree, they sound flat and excellent quality of sound. Just enough bass and the deep bass is eargasm. They only have one con, cable permamently attached to the cans (quite long) , but you can modify it with some parts and iron solder. 100% recommended and will buy another pair to replace Sony when they brake in next 100 years.
customer_reviews.author: Assassin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality, comfort and sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Really great headphones. I have sensory issues and wear headphones for long periods of the day. These are really comfortable and dont hurt even after wearing them most of the day. They work great for blocking out noise even though there are not ANC and actually perform bettter than some ANC headphones i have had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Calum

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've had yet.
customer_reviews.text: There are the best headphones I've had yet and they're worth every penny! I've no complaints at all. I feel my mixing hs improved just having this upgrade... I can hear everything so much more clearly and balanced out I didn't have studio monitors when I first got these so this was a huge huge step up! I now have studio monitors but find myself using these headphones when mixing half the time, worth every penny! Very happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Great value headphones, improved by leather pads.
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried the 770 Pro, I found them to be bit too bright for my tastes. I swapped out the default pads for leather pads, this really helped and now they are my go to closed back wired headphones. I pair these with my Daraginfly Cobalt and they sound very good, great wide oundstage (hard to believe for a £100 closed back headphone) and fantastic clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E. Reeves -smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: These are just quality! There is a good reason they are in practically every good recording studio - they are the SM58 of studio headphones! So comfy, so lightweight, and a perfectly balanced sound. They make my previous Senheiser monitor headphones, which were a similar price look like cheap, fake headphones
customer_reviews.author: paul cook

customer_reviews.title: No Sounds isolation
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as they are SUPPOSED to have good sound isolation I put them on and bearing in mind that I am partially deaf, and I can still clearly hear my son speaking quietly across a 25 foot room. Atrociously false advertising, I would recommend that the description of these be altered immediately since that is a completely false statement, and as such illegal. About the only way these might isolated from sound is if you have heavy metal at full blast.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of headphones around this price range and was impressed with the reviews for these. I wasn’t let down, a much better sound stage from them. I’ve linked them to a Fiio EK10 and the quality is very noticeable! I’m using them to master my tracks in Reason, and I can hear far more fidelity and detail at both ends. An actual bargain at sub £100. Recommend for audiophiles!
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to receive these having looked at all the positive reviews. Best way to describe these, is that I felt like I was listening to music in the far distance the whole time I was wearing them. The mids and highs are clear, but the bass is absolutely non-existent. Like there is genuinely minimal bass even at high volume. How are you supposed to level sound in DAWs with no bass? These headphones wear super comfortable, but I could just never justify £100 for something which doesn’t even sound as good as my Apple earphones that came free with my phone. They genuinely sound better than these overall.
customer_reviews.author: Rosstar

customer_reviews.title: Study headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great for studying, I was looking for a pair that had good noise cancellation and were comfortable for glasses wearers. These are perfect. Very comfortable, maybe get the 32 ohm versions for gaming, the 80 versions I got are on the quieter side using my pc, as I’m listening to chill out music whilst I study it’s no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. L. Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Such a unique sound
customer_reviews.text: I've been a proud Beyerdynamic user for almost a decide now, starting with a pair of DT 880 PRO's (which I still use to this day). I sought after some different sounds though, and the DT 770 PRO's certainly don't disappoint. I now happily use both as my daily drivers to get the very best out of both of their respective sounds. Highly recommended for those who seek superior sound quality to the average pair of headphones today!
customer_reviews.author: Avalanche

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Have used these headphones for a while now. Sound is excellent with the Classical and Metal music I mostly have used them for. The earcup padding is extremely comfortable, even on long wears and I've never had a moment where it's given my ears any discomfort. Used for listening to music and gaming, both uses are brilliant. The 80 Ohm doesn't require any amp for the PC, they sound perfect and I'd recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: H. Tulley

customer_reviews.title: BUY
customer_reviews.text: Quality for quite an untrained ear does not differ from DT990, the only difference is the cable and sound isolation. DT770 isolates way better, while DT990 were made with something else in mind. Both items lovely, comfortable. Best Christmas gift for myself. Hehe
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Great set of monitor headphones for music and gaming if you don't need a mic.
customer_reviews.text: No active noise cancellation, but plenty of sound isolation that makes background noise pretty much a none issue. Sound profile is quite flat, but anything that can drive these probably has an equalizer you can use to change that if you wish. Actual sound quality and clarity are amazing, this is a very well made unit and one of few I can put on over my glasses without discomfort thanks to the padding. Definitely reccomended if you don't care about having a built in microphone.
customer_reviews.author: peter burns

customer_reviews.title: Perfect neutral sound for video editing.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after returning the shockingly bass-heavy audio technica m50x. They sound amazing. Build is great, ear pads comfy as heck but the sound! Listened to the intro sequence from Penny Dreadful and it made me gasp at how rounded and detailed and spacious it was. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: digitalis

customer_reviews.title: If these break I'm getting another
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones, I shall use them until they break and then buy another pair! The 80 ohm doesn't come with a coiled cable, I was kind of expecting it to. Just means I need to put put the awesomely long lead through my belt hooks before making it to my (ancient) ipod, to stop me tripping on them. The lack of coils on the 80s is why it isn't 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: RFW

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'm no headphone geek but these sound amazing to me. The level is maybe slightly lower than others due to the being the 250 Ohm. But they're still well loud enough as I'm using them plugged into my Focusrite Pro 40 audio interface or plugged straight into my Keyboards (Nord, Kronos). The sound quality is great and the look and feel is top end. I love the retro quality plastic used and the velour pads are very nice. They are very comfortable. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Gaming headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for mostly playing counterstrike in, but also doing some studio work on a DAW. The sound quality is 100 times better than the logitec g430's i was using, and on CS the footstep positioning was much clearer too even without digital 7.1 (because digital 7.1 is a gimmick). I use a scarlett 2i4 interface so no idea if these would work properly straight into your sound card, but they are far louder than the logitechs this way too.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but lousy structure with pinch hazzard.
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these headphones is superb and I purchased the open back version as well as the closed back. However the build quality is very bad. It's too easy to get your fingers and thumbs pinched tight in the metal section connecting the earcups to the headband. A small gap, just where you hold the hinge section has an opening that closes when the headband is opened up to place over the head.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Stranraer

customer_reviews.title: First real pair of cans
customer_reviews.text: From first impressions I can say that they are very comfortable and I hardly notice them whilst on my head. Only real let downs are their plasticity build quality (however still feels decent) and the fact when used with a mobile device they are quite quiet which could easily be fixed with a headphone amp. Sound wise, they are quite balanced and by far the best headphones I have ever heard or owned. My primary use case for these will be recording and mixing guitar tracks in reaper and I feel that these will accomplish all that I need them to.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro 80 Ohm is a great choice if you like bass. You can still hear those Beyerdynamic highs, although not as prevalent as on their other headphones. Mids are great for a headphone at this price. The bass is out of this world. It is very well controlled and never bleeds into the mids. It's got a lot of weight to it and is very punchy. Overall, great bass head headphone. At this price it's a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Nick B.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. Compared them to my AKG 240 and the first ting you notice is the huge difference in clarity without any frequency being boosted. Not saying the cheaper AKG's are bad, but in comparison....well there's no comparison really. Comfortable as well. To be honest, I also have a pair of Sony MDR 7506 which are a little more pricey but has even more detail showing through, but overall I like to do 90% of the editing and mixing with the Beyerdynamic's then fine tune with the Sony's. I easily recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Good if you keep forgetting your way home and need ...
customer_reviews.text: Just be warned the cable is not detachable and is about 400 km long so you can probably listen to your home sound system from work. Good if you keep forgetting your way home and need a way to remind yourself. Great sound though, just not very portable. I leave them at my work desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mazey Dribble

customer_reviews.title: Happy ears
customer_reviews.text: My ears are so happy with these headphones the only downside is the cable for when you're out and about have to tuck it in but at home fine i use it to tie up the misses and still can listen to my music happy days
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wyeth

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, although after just over a year, faltering
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review as I'm not too sure who to get in contact with as this was purchased from Amazon so no option is available to contact the seller. These headphones are incredible, but sadly, after just over a year of use, the right headphone on my pair have started buzzing and its become to off-putting that I can no longer use them anymore. They are great headphones, but if this happens in less than two years of use (I've had mine since the end of March, 2018), I can't really recommend. Hoping to resolve this issue with the seller soon.
customer_reviews.author: DK 18

customer_reviews.title: Astonishing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am using my new DT770 250 ohm with my LG V20 phone. All my music in DSD, FLAC and high bit rate MP3s sound amazing. Bass very well controlled and accurate. Great expansive sound stage. These headphones are much better than my other £150 and £200 headphones.
customer_reviews.author: B. Shah

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: I'm staring out in music production and these headphones were recommended to me. I purchased them after some research, but I am quite disappointed. For a product costing almost 100 GBP, the sound quality is average. The pitch range is not what was advertised and I get crackling noises on some music pieces. Usually, I buy cheap in-ear buds (mostly Sony) for 10-15 GBP and the sound is not much worse. The base might be slightly better on the Beyerdynamic phones but at least my Sony's never crackle. To be frank, I don't see the point of spending 10 times more money on a product that is only about 3% better than my usual cheap alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Hilde

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing comfort and sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I record my own songs in a bedroom and need to record vocals without sound spill to the microphone. These are very comfortable and the sound quality is amazing, I can hear things I never heard before. They are a little bass heavy so not ideal for final mixing
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: ... much research these seemed to be one of the best options out there
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile but when my Sennheiser 280 Pro's died on one side (I am going to attempt a repair at some point) I needed another set of closed headphones and after much research these seemed to be one of the best options out there. They feel great, sound quality is tip top and they do a fantastic job at keeping outside noises to a minimum. Would happily recommend them
customer_reviews.author: deanimate

customer_reviews.title: Honest headphones. Great for producing. Go for lower ohm set if you want higher volume.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for producing. Love them, very comfy, robust and the coiled cable is ideal for me. They are relatively quiet due to their high ohm rating but you wont have to worry about them getting blown. You may want to consider less ohm rated in the same model if you want to listen at higher volumes. This will all depend on the equipment you are plugging them into. Using them straight out of the headphone Jack on your computer or mobile phone for example may leave you wanting more volume. Great honest sound, german made, recomend the range highly.
customer_reviews.author: Boothakus

customer_reviews.title: Overall amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: Overall i really liked the headphones. One issue i have is that it clamps on with a lot of force, while they don't fall off, after extended use it can cause mild discomfort. One thing i wish it had would be a volume controller. relying on the windows volume control is far from ideal. But considering the price its really good. DT 770 PRO + mod mice makes a great headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but leak sound way too much
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as stated: they are studio headphone, very middle of the road, they don't over-emphasize any region of the audio range. I use them connected to a turntable because I want the pure sound of vinyl without any extra processing. This can sometimes backfire as they don't provide that extra 'oomph' for some favorite songs :) Extremely leaky tho - to the point that you can listen to the music without putting them on... Comfortable to wear, good design.
customer_reviews.author: Valentin

customer_reviews.title: DT 770 pro
customer_reviews.text: IThe lower range is good but a critical area in the upper range missed the hiss on a mp4 that I could hear on an iPhone and a pair of lower priced sony headphones from Amazon. This is unexpected and these clearly can’t be used for monitoring. I’ll buy some others. No problem with amazon and I’ll be happy to buy from here again.
customer_reviews.author: Keep it simple

customer_reviews.title: Top headphones in price range.
customer_reviews.text: Really fell in love with the stereo imaging of these. Great clarity and overall design. For me personally, the eq response curve is a little too trebly/piercing on some frequencies, but nothing that can't be handled with a little eq in my DAW/DSP.
customer_reviews.author: Fred A. Stares

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are absolutely fantastic. Had them for quite some time now (bought in 2014) and they are still sound as good as the day I bought them. I have worn them upwards of 12 hours out of a day and while not comfortable for that entire time, they're certainly more comfortable than any other set of headphones I have owned. They also take quite a beating - I have managed to damage them only recently and that's because I sat on them (my bad). Aside from that, they've survived drops etc without issue. Very happy with them and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Whats not to like?
customer_reviews.text: classic phones for home or studio - superb value - sound is a good neutral flat response for recording and production and isulates well from others in room and its noise. Available in various impedance ranges too. Nicely produced music sounds fantastic but flawed recordings sound as such. Revealing!!
customer_reviews.author: Clivo

customer_reviews.title: Sound great even without an AMP despite what people say
customer_reviews.text: I have not got my hands on an AMP/DAC yet but even without it, they sound great. People say that without an AMP they will sound quiet but they sound good, not as loud as my other 32 OHM headphones but still i can hear everything. They are pretty quiet on phones those so if you are buying the 250ohm version strictly for you Phone then you will probably need an AMP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, great sound quality (albeit v shaped profile, highs can be a little much sometimes). Isolation is fantastic, I struggle to hear anything going on around me and I don't listen at particularly high volumes. Comfort is fantastic. Great for gaming, great clear sound stage. You can tell exactly where noise are coming from.
customer_reviews.author: Fluke~

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable - with good natural sound
customer_reviews.text: I wear headphones for hours on end. These are comfortable and the audio is not distorted or overly bassy. True sound which is what I wanted. Highly recommended for professional audio monitoring while recording speech in audiobooks and other voice work.
customer_reviews.author: H M Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Have got these for my vocal booth, after recommendations from fellow artists. And am not disappointed. The audio quality is good, without any effects being added by headphones themselves. And they are super comfy to wear, so using them for hours is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sakshi

customer_reviews.title: There German quality built to a high spec.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are good with most genres other than more bass heavy tunes. The clarity and soundstage are astonishing at this price point. Very a pleasure to wear fairly light and they leak very little sound even when cranked up a notch or three. I’ve been putting them through a Sparten Helot valve amp and they are pucker. There’s enough bass there very mid centric and the treble is precise high hats and cymbals sounds great. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen patrick mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to wear and isolate sound well. Transparent sound that match my reference speakers well. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Les More

customer_reviews.title: Great Listening Experience
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones for music production and listening. Though I did find the soundstage was a little narrow for gaming (tracking footsteps etc.) So I would still recommend open back headphones for this. But overall these are great build quality, comfortable and a great quality set headphones. P.s DAC amp recommended for the best experience , even on the 80 ohm variant.
customer_reviews.author: Sebba

customer_reviews.title: For the price, these are worth it time and again.
customer_reviews.text: First impressions of these headphones is that they are fantastic, they are comfortable, the material is great and sits very nice over your ears. Sound quality is best I've ever had from headphones. I've used these headphones for over a year now, even having taken them to University. I couldn't recommend more. I did have to wash the muffs eventually, but they came off alright and I'm considering new muffs for the side. I can't see a situation where I'd buy anything but these again.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Laverick

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Phenominal
customer_reviews.text: These are so good I've started plugging them into my main amp just to listen to music.. As monitors they are amazing - every detail is caught so you snuff that door creak, unwanted tap and properly balance your tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly my windows phone nokia 830 can drive these pretty well without an amp
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality, decent bass and lovely sub paired with FiiO E10K, however, I do get a rattle in the left ear if the cable shakes hard enough, which usually only happens with walking. Surprisingly my windows phone nokia 830 can drive these pretty well without an amp, a little lacking in volume but surprisingly loud nonetheless. Pretty comfortable but after long sessions can weigh down on ears, and the ridge of my ear just touches the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Leone

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant headphones for electric drums
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve got an electric drum kit then I highly recommend these headphones. The build quality is fantastic, and the sound quality even better. The inline volume adjustment is handy and they feel like they’ll last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Plant

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. I have bought plenty of noise cancelling and very expensive headphones in the past and this outperforms all of them in both sound and build quality. A pure accurate sound that lacks any interference. You can add your own preferences in eq if you choose
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Scott

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Comfortable - Even with glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Literally never wrote an Amazon review before: these headphones inspired me otherwise. I was musing over them whilst playing video games thinking: "Not only have these not caused me any bother to wear, but they're so comfortable that I enjoy having the soft ear pads over my ears" - I have a big head, and they're ideal. The sound is great, the comfort is great, they're not even close to too heavy, and they look pretty awesome too. I often wear them with my thin-templed glasses; no complaints there either. Perfectly comfortable. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Place

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic home studio headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my home studio and they work a treat. (Voice over) No fancy EQ to mess with what I’m hearing, great comfort and spacious over the ears. No much bleed through when recording but still a bit (you can’t have it all!)
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones for bedroom producer!
customer_reviews.text: Great Headphones for the money, I have really enjoyed them great pure sound just what i wanted the do need a lot of power being 250 ohm's so don't expect them to be mega loud! highly recommend for music professional.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Swain

customer_reviews.title: Get these. Better than any £200 headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pair of headphones for the price. Much better than anything I have previously owned, even more expensive headphones. When I purchased these I had no amp or dac so I went with the 80 ohms which is absolutely fine. But in hindsight I would now have chosen the 250 version. Whichever you get will be great though. Aesthetic shouldn't be a big point when it comes to buying headphones, but these look so good. They have a really retro kind of look and the black with grey pads looks really nice. Construction is great, materials are fine. I've had these headphones for over a year now and still like out of the box. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Krim

product_meta.title: beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO Studio Headphones - 80 Ohm
product_meta.description:
Style Name:80 OHM (Studio)For decades now, professional users all around the world have placed their trust in our classic range: DT 770/880/990 PRO. These benchmark-setting studio headphones, available in three different models, boast extremely detailed resolution and very transparent sound.

The DT 770 PRO headphones is the range’s closed-back model and offers maximum flexibility and detailed sound that you can rely on.

The beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO headphones have established themselves as a firm favourite amongst music producers, sound engineers and broadcasters and are used in studios all over the world. They reproduce the entire frequency range with incredible precision, and even reproduce low frequencies in punchy detail.

The headphones are designed for critical music and sound monitoring, providing a perfectly neutral listening environment with exceptional isolation and top-notch impulse response. High frequencies are translated into an analytical and differentiated sound. Ultra-low bass sounds are defined and reproduced crisply.
feature_bullets: Closed over-ear headphones, ideal for professional recording and monitoring
Perfect for studio and stage recordings thanks to their pure, high-resolution sound. Headphone frequency response 5 - 35.000 Hz
The soft, circumaural and replaceable velour ear pads ensure high wearing comfort
Hard-wearing, durable and robust workmanship Made in Germany
Practical single-sided cable (3.0 m cable). Headphone frequency response: 5Hz - 35 KHz. Nominal sound pressure level: 96 dB

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,142 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
